intro: Plectritis major, commonly known as slender plectritis, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Plectritis major thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
